content.rendered:
[vc_row][vc_column width=”5/12″ offset=”vc_col-lg-5 vc_col-md-5″][stm_spacing xs_spacing=”40px”][stm_single_image img_alignment=”right” img_id=”2415″ img_size=”910×483″][/vc_column][vc_column width=”7/12″ offset=”vc_col-lg-7 vc_col-md-7″][stm_spacing xs_spacing=”40px” lg_spacing=”73px” md_spacing=”73px” sm_spacing=”73px”][stm_title title_tag=”h2″ sep_color=”green” title=”Children Learning Together” sep_enable=”true”][/stm_title][vc_column_text css=”.vc_custom_1455185545032{margin-bottom: 0px !important;}”]From 10 faculty members, 40 students and three fields of study at the time of its founding, Secondary School has grown to more than 1,600 faculty, 35,000 students and over 350 degree programs in 130 academic departments and 80 interdisciplinary research units. One of the most important things we can do for students is not just teach them specific knowledge and skills, but help them match their interests to their career path.[/vc_column_text][stm_spacing xs_spacing=”40px”][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row full_width=”stretch_row” css=”.vc_custom_1455192302689{padding-top: 45px !important;padding-bottom: 100px !important;background-color: #ffffff !important;}”][vc_column width=”7/12″][stm_image_box title_position=”outside” sep_color=”green” title=”Doing Research at School” img_id=”2424″ sep_enable=”true” title_link=”url:%23||” css=”.vc_custom_1455734826284{margin-bottom: 40px !important;}”]DoResearch, the website of the Office of the Vice Prosoft and Dean of Research, provides comprehensive information about the research enterprise at Secondary School.

  • DoResearch
  • Research Administration

[/stm_image_box][stm_image_box title_position=”outside” sep_color=”green” title=”Dedicated Research Centers” img_id=”2425″ sep_enable=”true” title_link=”url:http%3A%2F%2Fsmartyschool.stylemixthemes.com%2Fcourse-schedule%2F||” css=”.vc_custom_1455734874232{margin-bottom: 40px !important;}”]Several independent labs, centers and institutes engage faculty and students from across the school. Academic departments sponsor numerous other research labs.

  • Independent Laboratories, Centers and Institutes
  • Research Centers (A – Z)

[/stm_image_box][stm_image_box title_position=”outside” sep_color=”green” title=”Integrated Research & Teaching” img_id=”2426″ sep_enable=”true” title_link=”url:http%3A%2F%2Fsmartyschool.stylemixthemes.com%2Fclasses%2F||” css=”.vc_custom_1455734913061{margin-bottom: 40px !important;}”]The synthesis of teaching and research is fundamental to School. Much of this faculty-driven research takes place within academic departments and interdisciplinary programs.

  • Schools
  • Academic Departments (A – Z)
  • Interdisciplinary Programs

[/stm_image_box][stm_image_box title_position=”outside” sep_color=”green” title=”Library” img_id=”2427″ sep_enable=”true” title_link=”url:%23||”]Secondary School is home more than 20 individual libraries, each with a world-class collection of books, journals, films, maps, databases.

  • Secondary School Libraries
  • Online Catalog (SearchWorks)
  • Ask a Librarian

[/stm_image_box][/vc_column][vc_column width=”5/12″][stm_text_box title_tag=”h3″ button_color_scheme=”white-secondary” button_position=”right” sep_color=”custom” title_color=”custom” text_color=”custom” stm_bg_color=”blue” title=”School Research at a Glance” sep_enable=”true” button_text=”Learn more” button_link=”url:%23||” sep_color_custom=”#ffffff” title_color_custom=”#ffffff” text_color_custom=”#ffffff” text_margin_b=”34px”]

Faculty

  • 2,118 faculty members
  • 21 Nobel laureates
  • 4 Pulitzer Prize winners

The Research Enterprise

  • 5,300 externally sponsored projects
  • $1.33 billion total budget
  • About 2,000 postdoctoral scholars
  • 18 independent labs, centers and institutes

Libraries

  • 9.3 million physical volumes
  • 4 million e-books and audiovisual materials
  • 300,000 rare or special books and 59 million pages of unpublished materials

School Innovation

  • In 2014–15, Stanford received more than $95 million from 695 licensed technologies.
  • Breakthrough inventions licensed by Stanford span medicine, engineering and the sciences.
  • School entrepreneurs have created an estimated 39,900 companies and 5.4 million jobs since the 1930s.

[/stm_text_box][/vc_column][/vc_row]
